#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=FIFA World Cup 2018 Last 16 : France , Uruguay send Argentina , Portugal home
#Text=Tuesday , July 3 , 2018
#Text=On Saturday , France defeated Argentina 4 – 3 and Uruguay defeated Portugal 2 – 1 in the FIFA football World Cup in the Last 16 knockout phase .
#Text=France is scheduled to play against Uruguay for the quarter-finals .
#Text=France v Argentina
#Text=France faced Argentina in the first match of the Last 16 at the Kazan Arena .
#Text=Argentina had greater ball possession .
#Text=In the 11th minute , France was awarded a penalty kick after Marcos Rojo received a yellow card , bringing down Kylian Mbappé in the penalty area .
#Text=Antoine Griezmann scored from the penalty giving the French side an early lead .
#Text=In the 41st minute , Ángel Di María equalised for Argentina from outside the box , assisted by Éver Banega .
#Text=The first half ended 1 – 1 .
#Text=In the second half , Gabriel Mercado scored the second goal for Argentina from Lionel Messi 's assist , putting the South Americans in the lead in the 48th minute .
#Text=France equalised within ten minutes , when Benjamin Pavard scored a goal from outside the penalty area .
#Text=In the 64th minute , Mbappé scored the third goal for France and four minutes later Mbappé netted the fourth goal , from Olivier Giroud 's assist .
#Text=French midfielder Paul Pogba committed a foul in the injury time and Argentina won a free kick in the defensive half .
#Text=Sergio Agüero scored the third goal for Argentina from Messi 's assist .
#Text=The match ended with France emerging the winners .
#Text=Nineteen-year-old Mbappé became the first teenager to score two goals in the FIFA World Cup tournament since Brazilian Pelé when he achieved the feat in 1958 .
#Text=He was named Budweiser Man of the Match .
#Text=After the match , French coach Didier Deschamps said , "

#Text=After the match , Portugal 's coach Fernando Santos said ,  In football , there are no moral victories and I would have preferred to play worse and win the match .
